column1: Hulan District (simplified Chinese: 呼兰区; traditional Chinese: 呼蘭區; pinyin: Hūlán Qū) is one of nine districts of the prefecture-level city of Harbin
column3: Northeast China. It covers part of the northeastern suburbs. The district was approved to establish from the former Hulan County (呼兰县) by the Chinese State Council on February 4
column4: 2004. It borders Bayan County to the east
column7: and Songbei District to the southwest
column8: as well as the prefecture-level city of Suihua to the northwest.

column2: the Hulan District was home of Manchukuo veterans who became homeless because they failed to conscript the newly People's Liberation Army.
by Xiao Hong: a description of life in Hulan District
